isis.stitle: CAB: 5000i AND 9000i CONVENTIONAL - REMOVE - Remove TWO PIECE ENCAPSULATED WINDSHIELD

svcproc.title: Remove TWO PIECE ENCAPSULATED WINDSHIELD
svcproc.para: Refer to Figure 4 for Items in parentheses.
The 5000 i Series and 9000 i Series vehicles come standard with a one piece encapsulated windshield (Item 1). A two piece encapsulated windshield (Item 2) is available as an option.

important.para: To remove a two piece encapsulated windshield you will need to have the INTERNATIONAL® Bonded Windshield Tool Kit ZTSE4470. This kit has a tool box that includes the tools required to remove and install bonded windshields. To order, call toll free in U. S. and Canada 1-800-520-2584 or Fax 1-800-578-7375. NOTE - The INTERNATIONAL® Bonded Windshield Tool Kit ZTSE4470 is no longer available through the INTERNATIONAL® tool supplier. For materials that are available contact INTERNATIONAL® service parts.

note.para: Before starting to remove and replace a windshield, it is required that a self-carboning form from INTERNATIONAL® titled "Bonded Windshield Replacement Report" be filled out completely to confirm the condition of the vehicle and record the lot numbers of the Essex® materials used before starting the work. Refer to Figure 183 for a sample form at the back of this Manual.

step1.para: Chock the wheels and unlatch fiberglass tilt hood on both sides. Raise hood to full open position.
Place protective coverings over areas near windshield.

Before removing windshield, it will be necessary to remove the windshield wiper arms and blades. Refer to
WINDSHIELD WIPER ARM AND BLADE ASSEMBLY
, Remove Windshield Wiper Arm and Blade Assembly.

svcproc.para: Refer to Figure 5 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para:
If the unit is equipped with an exterior sun shade (Item 1) place a piece of tape (Item 2) on bottom side of the three sun shade mounting brackets (Item 3). This will protect sun shade mounting bracket paint while using cutting tool to remove windshield. If it is desired to remove sun shade, refer to
SUN SHADE
, Remove Sun Shade for 5000 i or 9000 i Series as required.
Remove two-piece encapsulated windshield (Item 2, Figure 4) as follows:

svcproc.para: Refer to Figure 11 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Using a utility knife (Item 1) cut urethane adhesive on both sides of windshield center divider bar trim strip (Item 2) at windshield center divider bar (Item 3) to make it easier to remove windshield center divider bar trim strip.

figure.caption: Figure 11. Removing Windshield Center Divider Bar Trim Strip

calloutgroup.callout1: 2. WINDSHIELD CENTER DIVIDER BAR TRIM STRIP

svcproc.para: Refer to Figure 12 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Remove windshield center divider bar trim strip (Item 1) by prying it out with a blunt screwdriver (Item 2) and pulling it out of windshield center divider bar (Item 3).

figure.caption: Figure 12. Removing Windshield Rubber Trim Flange at Center Divider Bar

calloutgroup.callout1: 1. WINDSHIELD CENTER DIVIDER BAR TRIM STRIP

svcproc.para: Refer to Figure 6 for all Items in parentheses.

step1.para: If removing driver side windshield only, remove four fastener covers (Item 1) from driver side A pillar trim panel (Item 2), then remove four torx self-drilling screws (Item 3) and remove driver side A pillar trim panel. Lay out of the way and save for reinstallation. Then proceed with Step 11 below.

If removing passenger side windshield only, remove two fastener covers (Item 4) from two upper fasteners only on passenger side A pillar trim panel (Item 5), then remove three torx self-drilling screws (Item 6). Note that the bottom torx self-drilling screw (Item 6) goes through the inner side cab trim panel. Use blunt tip screwdriver to pry the side cab trim panel out slightly to remove passenger side A pillar trim panel. Lay out of the way and save for reinstallation. Then proceed with Step 11 below.
If removing both driver and passenger side windshields perform both Steps 8 and 9 above, then proceed with Step 11 below.

Remove ten torx pan head screws (Item 1, Figure 7) from each half of the defroster duct cover panel (Item 2, Figure 7) and remove both halves of the defroster duct cover panels. Lay out of the way and save for reinstallation.

If removing passenger side windshield only, once passenger side A pillar (Item 5, Figure 6) and defroster duct cover panels (Item 2, Figure 7) are removed, remove two torx self-drilling screws (Item 7, Figure 6) from passenger side window demist duct with rubber tube (Item 8, Figure 6) and remove them. Lay out of the way and save for reinstallation.

warning.para: To avoid personal injury, wear protective eye wear and work gloves when removing windshield.

step1.para: Using a utility knife (Item 1, Figure 8) lift outer flange of encapsulation rubber trim (Item 2, Figure 8) and cut encapsulation rubber trim flange off all the way around windshield, driver side windshield shown.

svcproc.para: Refer to Figure 9 for all Items in parentheses.

note.para: When using a power knife to cut around the old windshield, use a spray bottle and lubricate the cutting area with water. This will prevent burning of the urethane and re-bonding of the windshield.

caution.para: When replacing only driver or passenger side windshield, use caution while using power knife to cut out windshield at the center divider bar so that the good windshield is not disturbed or damaged while cutting out the broken windshield.

step1.para: Using a power knife (Item 1) with outside cutting blade (Item 2) and/or inside cutting blade (Item 3) cut all the way around windshield until it is able to be lifted off the cab windshield fence. If necessary use a long handle utility knife (Item 4) to cut through adhesive if windshield will not lift off cab windshield fence, driver side windshield shown.
Once the windshield (Item 1, Figure 13) is cut free from cab windshield fence, lift it off the cab. Place windshield out of the way, driver side windshield shown.
